2. @fig-lake below shows the data from a lake field study. Using this, answer the following questions:  

```{r}
#| label: fig-lake
#| fig-cap: "**Change in chlorophyll concentration with different pH values.** Results of lake field study testing chlorophyll concentration versus pH. Points represent raw data, and the line and shaded region represent linear trend."
#| fig-align: center
#| fig-width: 3.5
#| fig-height: 2.5
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| echo: false

library(tidyverse)

set.seed(1)
df <- data.frame(pH = runif(60, 2, 13)) %>% 
  mutate(chl = 5 + 0.8 * pH + rnorm(60, sd = 5))
m <- lm(chl ~ pH, df)
r2 <- summary(m)$r.squared

df %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = pH, y = chl)) +
  geom_point(color = "blue", alpha = 0.6) +
  # regression line with CI
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE, color = "red", fill = "red", alpha = 0.2) +
  # R² annotation
  annotate("text",
           x = min(df$pH) + 2,
           y = max(df$chl) - 2,
           label = paste0("R² = ", round(r2, 2)),
           color = "red") +
  labs(title = paste("Chlorophyll vs pH (R² ~", round(r2, 1), ")"),
       x = "pH",
       y = "Chlorophyll concentration") +
  theme_classic(base_size = 8)
```

a. Name the independent and dependent variables in the study, and mention for each whether it is an abiotic or a biotic factor. **(2 pt)** \vspace{2cm}  
a. What does the amount of chlorophyll serve as a proxy for in this study? In other words, what does this value tell you about the lake water? **(1 pt)** \vspace{2cm}  
a. What kind of organism(s) are being monitored in this study? Circle one: autotrophs | heterotrophs **(1 pt)**  
a. Name the role of these organism(s) in the food web of the lake (hint: trophic level). ________________ **(1 pt)**  
a. Would you say @fig-lake is showing a logistic, exponential, or linear **growth curve**? **(1 pt)** \linebreak Circle one: logistic | exponential | linear | none
